inn1.comm: hostile start, spearing that one in at 82.6 mph, right up there, a touch of swing, too and making the batsman play, defensively, first up
inswing aiming towards middle peg, low, and there's a very early boundary for Bangladesh, a nicely timed flick off the wrist in front of midwicket. Great shot
straight, pitched up there again and Tamim defends that down with the full face and holds his pose for the camera. He then rehearses the shot, just to make sure

a touch wide, short, and that's the kind of shot you'd expect only when your eye is - seems it's already in - good length ball just lifted over extra cover and that sails up and away. What a cracking shot
good response from Anderson, shooting the bouncer past the nose, Tamim sitting down away from the ball
a half-shout for that one
Shariar to face his first ball, and that one's driven to the covers. A loosener and Mahmood got away with it
on leg and that's tucked off the hips behind square to get him off the mark

and he has! Mahmood strikes! That one's banged in with plenty of pace and Tamim has no answer to that one which gets very, very big on him, he sways back, trying to sway away from the ball, but he can only poke the face of the bat towards the vacant fifth slip where Collingwood does well, running round from gully
stays over to the righthander and tests him immediately with one which pings through on a length, too quick for him
that one comes in at him, surprising him, and he does well to fend it down off the glove
just a touch short, and that's skewed into the midwicket with an unconvincing pull shot
outside off, cuts back in off the seam to the lefthander and an inside edge nearly crashes onto the stumps
peach. Juicy one, too, pitching straight and nipping away at him off the seam and also there's some movement in the air. Bashar smiles - what else can he do?!
poked into short midwicket this time
goes wider over the wicket this time, and that's wide down off - you could see what he was trying to do, tempt the batsman into the shot, but the execution wasn't quite there
much straighter, die-straight in fact, and that's worked over to short midwicket
more movement in the air away from the batsman, and that arcs through on a testing length, Bashar tempted to swish at it away from his body
a good example of tip-and-run, that one dabbed down into the covers and the batsmen run through, eluding the best efforts of the quick man at cover
hostile again - nipping back from just outside off at 137.8kph (85mph) and it's only just to say dealt with
straight bouncer - this time at 87mph - and Bashar shapes to hook but pulls out at the last minute, realising that was too quick and he just gets his lid out of the way
fast again, but there's enough width for Bashar to cut that away behind point to Pietersen, although it did seem to come off the back of his bat
the batsman pulls his bat inside the line of the ball and it rushes through to Nixon
and he loses his length this time, that one a simple half-volley that's easily driven through the covers
good timing this, the ball on middle-and-leg and it's driven out past Vaughan at midwicket who sets off in successful pursuit
that one's just got too much angle on it, shuffled across the lefthander who pokes his hands down on it and sends it down to gully - Collingwood with some tidy, enthusiastic efforts there
Panesar's in the action for the first time today and don't the crowd love it. Yes. The batsman opens the face and runs it down to him at deep backward point
bouncer, short and high - but too high
right up there on the money and that's defended forward
a hint of swing again, away from the righthander, who simply presses his bat on the ball which rolls into the covers
ah, Bashar was done then and his nods show he knows it too - playing away from his body, a flashing cover drive that only just fails to connect with an edge
just down leg
just outside off and that's driven behind point and the captain steals the strike
short and that's poked off the glove into short midwicket
short again and that's defended back to the bowler
good length, on off, and that's driven out well to Vaughan in the covers - pure timing -  who returns it quickly
regulation ball, regulation defence

well, that was quite extraordinary. Vaughan, who's not the best fielder in the world, made his normal efforts look Jonty-like by dropping that most armchair of sitters at short midwicket. Fortunately for him he put his anger to good, if accidental, use by flinging the ball over to Nixon ... and getting the run out. Nafees, then, keeps his wicket and Bashar loses his - Bashar had given up, and was just dawdling, having turned his back on Vaughan, expecting him to hold on to that one
gets off the mark immediately with one which is overpitched on leg stump and that's an easy single
turned off the hips down to the crowd's favourite Panesar
shuffles that one through close to the bat
driven to Pietersen in the covers
doesn't get hold of that attempted pull
tucked off the legs to square
more carry and he brings up his hands to try to defend that one outside the off stump, but the ball doesn't brush the glove
short and that's driven straight to Collingwood in the covers
gets right over the ball and defends it to the covers
short and that's defended back into the short midwicket region

and this time Mahmood does take his second wicket. Nafees went to drive that one and Nixon only got a glove on it, but he did parry it volleyball-like over to Strauss at second slip who clung on without fuss
short, straight and up there and that's defended away first up
shows an early sign of intent, getting off the mark with a firm cover drive off the back foot. Lovely shot, off the meat of the bat
a touch of width and Panesar pleases his fans by tidying that one up on the deep boundary
straight, full, true and defended down off the back foot
straight, full, true and defended down off the back foot
straight and that's dabbed into the leg side, Saqibul not really getting hold of that one
he looked surprised by that bounce, but he really shouldn't have been - that's been the story of the morning - nevertheless, he defended it down splendidly
pushed right up there and that's tucked straight to the man square
poked to the man at short midwicket
a shimmy of swing away from the batsman, again that's on a good length
pushed right up there and that's driven to mid-on
pushed right up there and there's a very pleasing 'plink' of the bat as it's defended solidly and not a little crisply
straight and that bouncer flies through at chin height. Good swaying, we like the swaying
on leg and that's very well tucked in front of square for a wristy four that flies away
short and wide, cut hard down to third man and a sprawling and sliding Panesar cannot stop it
that one kicked and left Saqibul  flailing at thin air as it spat past him at 82mph
wide and again slashed to third man, Panesar takes it on the bounce
Mushfiqur goes right back and offers a very correct backward-defensive stroke, but he plays down the wrong line and the ball clatters into the top of his middle and off stumps
down the leg side, the ball flicks the pads and Nixon makes a good stop
Ashraful back and steers the ball into the covers
back and blocked, solid and very correct
Saqibul stands tall and plays to point, a bit cramped for that stroke
he attempts to pull but gets his timing all wrong and the ball drops at his feet. That was a bit lucky as it could have gone anywhere
pushed to Panesar at mid-off, a quick call and a good single
slower ball down the leg side, taken on the second bounce by Nixon. The speed gun shows that was 81mph, but if it was then I am having dinner with Kylie
that was quicker and Ashraful drives but the shot was a bit rushed
slower again, once more taken by Nixon on the second bounce and Ashraful was through a pull shot by the time it reached him ... but the gun says 84mph!
angled across the left-hander at 84mph, a rather wishy-washy push misses by some distance
another one fired across Saqibul - 85mph - which he again swishes at and misses, Nixon takes diving across first slip
third time on the target, Saqibul behind it to block
a brace of no-balls ... Flintoff gives a rueful smile. He's overstepping as he is looking for pace ... both those were 85mph+
into Saqibul's legs, he defensively pushes into the leg side
too wide and Saqibul cuts down to third man where Pietersen had replaced Panesar. Is that a tactical switch because the ball keeps going there and Vaughan wants the better fielder down there?
wide outside the off stump, a sniff of awayswing, and a wide is called. Nixon stands looking wronged
pushed into the leg side and Ashraful gets off the mark
back to the ball angled across the left-hander, this time Saqibul leaves rather than swings at
Super start, good line and length, Ashraful spars at one that bounced and Nixon holds an oh-so-simple catch. Steve Bucknor doesn't even have to delay and decide as Ashraful is quickly on his way
confident start from Aftab, whips the ball off middle and off, through midwicket and four all the way
Anderson too full again, and once more Aftab helps himself to easy runs through midwicket, sweetly clipped off his toes
a much better length, Saqibul forced back to defend
Saqibul once more driven onto the back foot. That's the length Anderson needs to bowl, forcing the batsmen back
short and at Saqibul's body, he does well to get up on tip toes and keep that down
turned to midwicket, another single there for Aftab. He's faced three balls and all eight of his runs have come in the same area
Saqibul pushes to cover
wide and slashed in the air to third man, Pietersen gallops 20 yards to his left and makes a good pick-up on the run right on the rope
Saqibul back - and a hint of a step to leg - and he pushes the ball gently to cover
short, a bit more bounce than expected, safely plopped into the off side
Flintoff offers too much width, Saqibul leans back and hits than up and over backward point - a quite deliberate shot - and it bounces a foot over the rope
too full and leg-stumpish, Aftab flicks to backward square leg
Aftab's brief cameo ends, a good-length delivery which he looks to drive, but he only succeeds in getting a thickish edge and Nixon does the rest
forward, punches to cover
short and extra bounce, Mortaza steps back and prods. That was more about self-defence than giving himself room
Anderson spots that and digs another one in just short, Mortaza jumps and prods to point
fuller, pushed firmly to cover and Collingwood round to field
Flintoff once more gives Saqibul too much width and he seizes on the opportunity, smashing the ball past extra cover. No foot movement, but none needed when you can hit the ball that hard
Flintoff repeats the delivery and Saqibul repeats the shot, with knobs on. Poor bowling
short, Saqibul swipes and misses
much fuller, and with no width the lack of foot movement really shows, he spars and just misses getting a nick
speared down the leg side, Nixon takes and makes one of those appeals that is purely designed to try to make the umpire forget to signal the wide. It fails
Saqibul pushes confidently to extra cover
Saqibul jumps back and drops the ball at his feet
Mortaga again jumps to leg and prods unconvincingly to cover
short, too much so
thick edge to third man, not controlled but effective
shortish and well placed into the leg side
turned into the leg side, no chance of a run
Anderson goes for the yorker, not quite up there, Mortaza drives to mid-off
good ball, well played, all correct and cover fields
outside off stump, no turn, Saqibul lunges and misses
Saqibul forward, the ball squirts off the outside edge along the ground to short third man
very correct forward defensive
two steps down the track and then blocked
short and wide, Saqibul steps back and cuts neatly behind square,  a big gap there and he found it well
swept from middle stump to deep square leg, no risk as even had he missed he was a long way forward
full, driven straight on the leg side, the man is deep and so an easy couple
fuller, Saqibul back to defend into the covers
tight line and length, Saqibul has to be content with pushing to cover
Groundhog Day, on the button and again played to cover
Short, Saqibul ducks, Bucknor delays and delays and finally summons the energy to signal a wide
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
turned to midwicket
easy defence first up
Panesar sticks that one on the dime and it's driven out slowly to mid-off
the batsman pleases his batmaker with a full face of the bat defence which he holds for a long time
a slip from Panesar, clutching as the ball's driven back to him (not a drop, though; it bounced)
tickled fine down to the leg of that description
like the man who turned down the Beatles, the batsman missed out on that full toss, driving it straight to mid-off
driven forward without much fuss
nips that one in back off the seam to the batsman, that's horrible syntax, but anyway he beats him for pace and bounce
outside off, slightly wider, and the batsman's tempted to flash at that
attempted bouncer - right idea, wrong line, very wrong in fact, skewing away down leg
width and that was a magnificent shot, as evidenced by the clear click of the bat, just striding into that one and playing it on the up - Anderson did well on the boundary
steeples that one in on middle and that's dibbed out to short midwicket, great running - the batsmen set off straight away and elude Bopara's efforts
round the wicket and that's defended stoutly, off the back foot, into the covers
may be dibbly, but that's right on a good length and that one can only be defended on the front foot

huge appeal for one which Collingwood thinks has run out the non-striker, his fingertips grazing the ball on its way through to taking off the bails. One or two replays only needed to confirm he was safely home
that one swings away past the righthander's deadly flashing blade
opens his shoulders and drives to cover
driven into the covers and there's a quick single
stays over the wicket and that's driven to mid-off
corker delivery first up! Pitches on line with middle and cuts away past the bat - just past - and just past the stumps, too
driven forward, without any power
more sharp intaking of breath as that one hits the deck and eludes the edge on the back foot, just
opens the face and runs that to point
stays over and that's defended forward off the back foot
pitched outside, so the appeal is worthless, and that's tucked off the pads fine
outside off and that's played off the back foot out to the covers
driven to Liam Plunkett at mid-off (who's on for Andrew Flintoff)
a hint of swing, takes the pace off the ball (62mph), and it just shaped in at the lefthander who defends on the front foot
tries to waft that into the leg side but ends up playing it forward instead
pushed right up there and turned into short midwicket
on leg and that's turned behind square, off the pads, for a quick single of a leg-bye variety
driven into the covers this time
outside off and that's poked down behind point
comes forward and looks to attack on the front foot, but ends up playing the opposite shot. A Saqibul defence if you will
outside off and that's driven to the covers
driven into the covers again, Vaughan takes the pace off the ball and Bell tidies up
on leg and that's worked fine off the legs to bring up the hundred and loud cheers greet that milestone, including some from England fans, which tells you a thing or two
bouncer, straight, and there's some periscopic defence there, yes there is
pushed up there, dabbed down, and Saqibul backs up well from the non-striker's end, looking for a run, and almost too well as he has to race back into his crease
eased out square this time

entertaining stuff by both sides there - Saqibul first, for Bangladesh, stepping across his crease and jinking that up and cheekily back over square, then Mahmood, for England, cuts it off inside the rope - just
dribbled out to midwicket and there's a quick single
right up there, on off, and that's played square down behind point
short and that swings away from the righthander at some pace and height
just a touch short and that's driven aerially and safely over the inner ring, down to Panesar at deep backward point
short and tries to pull that one but it's mistimed and they have to settle with the single to midwicket
straight, short, hostile and the batsman takes evasive action by swaying backwards
driven to long-on and there's a straight hit at the non-striker's end, but the batsman was well in
in the air, but safe, landing over Collingwood and in front of Panesar. Top, if not necessarily intended, placement
right up there and dug out to long-off
round the wicket, pushed up there, but Panesar collects
wide, floating outside the off stump, and a headrush of a flash nearly does for the batsman, the ball nipping slightly away from him
digs that one into the pitch
short and that's driven off the back foot to cover
and he does! Great ball from Panesar, straight and tempting the batsman to slog across the line to long-on. He misses it completely and the ball knocks back off stump
round the wicket, that one comes back in at the lefthander off the seam and that's tucked out to cover
defended down to the men around point
that one seams in at the lefthander - and over his head
a good line again, that one coming right in at the lefthander, following him, and he has to play down in defence
similar ball, similar result
driven to the covers
that one comes in again at the lefthander, but rushes past his shoulder without too much alarm
outside off, left alone
very correct defensive push to point
pushed into the covers and high drama as the run contemplated

tossed up, Rafique looks to hit him back over the top but doesn't really get hold of it and Andrew Strauss, halfway in from long-off boundary, catches the ball above his head shuffling backwards. Panesar celebrates as if he had just snared Tendulkar ...
he played for the turn but there wasn't any and the ball just misses the edge
watchfully played into the off
Saqibul forward, blocks, takes a step as if looking for the quick single but it was never an option
Saqibul cuts ... he absolutely lathered the ball and Collingwood at backward point dives to his left to make a superb stop look so easy
pushed into the leg side
steps back and flicks the ball into space at midwicket
Rafique plays the ball to backward point with an angled bat
Rafique into line to defend
turned behind square on the leg side, Mahmood had a lot of ground to make up and after a second's hesitation, they made the second with comfort
into the leg side, well stopped
Pushed back to the bowler. "Oh Monty, show me one," suggest Nixon.  Worryingly.
swept to deep square leg for his fourth ODI fifty. Well batted, but a lone effort
overpitched and a firm on drive, well hit
miscued drive squirts over the covers. As poor a shot as the previous one was good
full, driven back to Flintoff who takes a big stride to his left to gather the ball
again hit back at Flintoff with no real power
Saqibul defends against the backdrop of a sponsor-laden rather than black sightscreen
Flintoff on the spot and well defended
blocked ... and for the fourth time this over Flintoff fields off his own bowling
Flintoff drops short, Saqibul on it quickly to pull through midwicket with no real timing
full and wide, thumped with power up and over mid-off, four all the way. He really clobbered that
turned to backward point
Panesar slows down - 46mph - but the batsman not tempted to try to repeat the up-and-over treatment
pushed into the off side for a well-placed single
Saqibul back and pulls that straight, short mid-on fields
he really reaches forward to sweep the ball from a long way in front of him, keeps control and with it the strike
slightly short, 71mph, and pushed to mid-on
driven off the back foot to long-off, an easy run and Saqibul happy to give his partner four balls to face. In comes the field ...
tentative push to midwicket
Collingwood naggingly consistent, on the spot
Razzak drops into the off side, thinks about a run but quickly changes his mind when he sees his partner leaning on his bat
Razzak swings, gets a thick edge and the ball scurries to the rope through where first slip would have been. Collingwood just stares in disbelief
driven to mid-off, Strauss runs in and misfields
Razzak back, waits and the ball has no pace and he ends up swishing and missing
hard drive back to Panesar
Razzak chances his arm once too often, shaping to slam the ball over long-on but  it goes high and nowhere, Collingwood waits and takes a simple catch at short midwicket
Saqibul forward, very correct, Panesar bends to field
swept square, Mahmood lollops round and makes a decent diving stop on the boundary edge
Rasel plays a half-hearted drive and the ball shoots along the ground between the leaden-footed slips ... there's nobody back so four all the way
done by the bounce, Rasel fends at the ball as it gets big on him and the edge flies right into Andrew Flintoff's breadbasket at first slip

inn2.comm: left outside off, the ball swinging away a touch
more outswing, and a touch wider, and that's easily left alone
flies that one down off and Bell shows off his best leave
comes over across the off stump, the ball pitches on middle-and-leg and Bell flicks that off the pad
left alone outside off, well bowled again, and the Bangladesh fielders like that
more swing, more leaving
over the wicket and shapes that across the righthander, Vaughan defending his first ball tidily enough
on leg, poked just in front of square, and Bell's in a hurry at the non-striker's end, looking for a single - it was Vaughan's call and he sends him back. A direct hit ... wouldn't have been out
a touch of width and that's well cut away behind point
pushed right up there and that's defended forward
across the righthander again, that's poked into the covers and will they run? "No!"
pushed right up there and that's poked to short midwicket
outside off, cutting back in off the seam and that's left alone
well wide and that nobbles first slip on the slip. Cue Steve Harmison comparisons
drives straight to cover
rushed through down the off-side channel and that's just left alone
nips in off the seam at a tight angle, tucking Vaughan up for room and that's defended down
another wide, just, that one moving away in the air
more swing, and Vaughan nearly gets an edge on that one, but it keeps swinging away
driven back to the bowler
pushed right up there, Bell meets it with a solid bat
pushed right up there and defended forward
speaking of fight - England have lost a wicket! Bell slices that drive to point - looking to drive it much, much straighter, and that was an excellent diving catch there
lefthander to lefthander... and that one's on a good length and driven slowly back to the bowler
pushed right up there, and pushed back out to the covers
strays down leg and that's an easy way for Strauss to get off the mark, tucking that off the legs
down the off-side channel and Strauss leaves that alone outside off
across him again and that's poked to point
did what it said on the tin - went wide
grunts with the effort of planting that just outside off and the face is opened and that's run down to third man
outside off and that's classic Vaughan with a crisp cover-drive
down leg, a big appeal
right up there, asking the question, and the answer is a poke into midwicket
dropped. The keeper was standing up to the bowler there, that cuts away from him and there's an outside nick ... and a fumble. Oh dear
outside off and that's defended forward into the covers
down leg and there's just a fine edge (though it's called leg-byes) which stops short of the boundary - slow outfield down there
an intense shout for lbw, some late swing, and that indeed was well outside off and didn't swing back enough
just a touch short and that's driven well in front of midwicket for an easy four
pushed right up there and that's defended into the covers
outside off and that's defended forward
on off and that's defended into the covers
down the channel and the ball swings in, just a touch, good judgment from Strauss to leave that one
outside off and that's fended into the covers this time
outside off, and there's a misfield behind point by Aftab Ahmed, who took that cracker catch earlier - that should have been a dot
right up there, on off, and that's defended forward
outside off and that's fended down into the covers
on middle-and-leg and Strauss plays my favourite Strauss shot, a clip off the legs behind square - just times it and that races away
up there on a good length, Strauss strides strongly but can only push the ball back to the bowler
short and that's pulled in front of midwicket and it's just kept in by Ashraful - good work
poked off the front foot, no more than a prod, to gully
wide and Vaughan missed out - and nearly got out - scooping that up on the off side, but there was nobody close in
classic wicket-to-wicket delivery that, the bowler tight into the stumps and sending it very straight, Strauss with a neat defence in turn
driven straight to the covers
pushes the batsman onto his back foot with a straight one and that's just defended down without fuss
more of the straight stuff and more of the defensive stuff
doesn't get hold of a pull shot - it was fuller than expected and cramps him for room - but there's a misfield which allows the single
good length delivery on the off and that's a solid defence
defended forward
shortish ball there and driven to mid-on
too full for that pull shot
outside off, Strauss leans into the cover drive which goes straight to a fielder and is returned to the non-striker's end, Vaughan stretching to make it back
a tidy delivery, defended and yet another keeper takes a leaf out of the Gilchrist book "Aw, yes"
pushed right up there and that's a maiden
short, fended to short midwicket
clipped to midwicket, a quick call and Vaughan was struggling but the fielder didn't pick it up cleanly, the ball stuck in his fingertips and he couldn't let go!
short, on it like a cheetah and hammered high over midwicket, right off the meat of the bat
steered to point
Strauss goes back and pushes to midwicket, calls "yes ...no" and Vaughan has to apply the breaks and is almost stranded
too wide, a tad too short, Strauss cuts with real power to the left of point, and the dive is more for show than in expectation of stopping the ball. Four all the way
Vaughan waits and tries to angle the ball to the left of backward point, but the fielder makes a good diving stop
Vaughan taps into the covers, a quick call and an easy run as Aftab has to turn and throw, which he does, but by then Vaughan is home and dry
Strauss stands tall and punches the ball to mid-off
Strauss flicks the ball into the hands of midwicket
well bowled, a bit more lift and Strauss fences the ball down to third man, albeit after taking his bottom hand off the handle. An edge, but into space
gentle drive into the covers
short, pulled to deep square leg
Vaughan punches to extra cover off the back foot. No real turn so far
short again, Vaughan waits, opens the face and uses the pace of the ball (62mph)  to do all the hard work as it scurries down to the third-man rope
Vaughan again back but this one goes squarer
mistimed paddle to leg, the ball goes about ten feet
loud appeal from the bowler as Vaughan goes back and misses an attempted flick to leg. A good shout, were it not for the fact that you could see all three stumps when it hit him ...
Strauss upright and drives to extra cover
Strauss cuts and a super one-handed  stop by Mortaza in the gully
Strauss falls over as he shapes to hit across the line and misses, a loud, long, almost pleading,  appeal from Rasel ... Bucknor takes an age, even by his standards, before raising his finger
outside off and left alone
nonchalant steer to backward point
languid push to extra cover
Vaughan plays a nothing shot, and not very well at that
Vaughan back and drives the ball back to Razzak
wristy flick on the 45 behind square on the leg, using the pace of the ball to do the work
met with a dead bat
Vaughan pats the ball to cover
driven, with a bit too much bottom hand in evidence, to mid-on
leg-side line, flicked to midwicket but well stopped
Pietersen beaten by that, he prodded and missed as he shaped to run the ball to third man
low bounce, pushed to mid-off with no pace
driven, but not timed and the ball bobbles to extra cover
pushed to cover. Pietersen looking to get after it but trying to balance that with some common sense and biding his time ... but for how long
patted to mid-on and Pietersen gets off the mark
tip-and-run to midwicket, good calling
driven to the left of mid-off who makes a good diving stop but can't prevent the run
two steps from Pietersen and a swish through midwicket
Vaughan very correctly plays that with a straight bat
this time he uses his feet to come to the pitch of the ball and drive it to mid-on
slower and flighted, driven to mid-off
Vaughan back and flicks the ball to the man in the deep at square leg
short and Vaughan fails to time a punch off the back foot
slower ball, Vaughan reads it and drops it into the off side
Vaughan stands up and drives the ball, albeit off the toe-end of the bat, to extra cover
Vaughan pushes into the covers and runs a good single
defended into the off side
straight and patted back to the bowler
one step and driven to mid-off
Vaughan back, an easy single to deep square leg
Pietersen gallops to meet the ball and squirts it to deep square leg. A purist's nightmare
pushed through but that oen turned and that, plus some bounce, surprised Vaughan and he edged the ball wide of short third man
an appeal, but no chance of anything there
swished to deep square leg, a great leaping stop on the rope saves the four
sweet driven through the covers, finding the gap, but not quite timed
shapes to hit to leg, the ball skews to extra cover
another expansive drive attempted but once more it's not timed
a rather ugly heave through midwicket ... effective but not pretty
deft steer with an angled bat to third man
driven out through the covers
played down off the back foot through covers again
defended forward
more defence
goes he softly into the night. Oh dear, swept that one up and a top edge went high and higher and was taken easily by his opposing captain behind square
played on the back foot, defensively
on leg and that's patient from Pietersen, tucking that behind square, without too much fuss. No fuss, in fact
a tidy defence, crouching his long frame over that one
outside leg and that's swept out to deep backward square and there's a clue which end is the danger one "Keeper! Keeper!"
pitches on middle, low and Pietersen's tempted; getting a big stride in and missing the sweep - it was possibly turning down, too
steps into that one and drives it out to long-on
on leg and that's driven in front of midwicket
on leg and that's turned to the man on the short 45
on off-and-middle and that's defended forward
half an appeal for one which was going down leg
straight, drags that short and that's a boundary, it really is, an aerial drive over long-on, closed face and that's got the treatment. Shot
outside leg and that's tickled square
down the track, and that's a great catch at midwicket - just snapped up by Farhad - the ball speared in faster and that's a huge wicket
on the money, defended forward and "Yes, boy! Yes, boy!" Someone likes that
more defence
more button bowling, and that's just defended
walks into that shot, driving to midwicket
defence is the name of Collingwood's game here
straight and that's poked to the man in short in front of midwicket
on middle and that's driven to long-on
right up there and dug out through extra cover, actually it somehow gets to the rope, just a mere push
driven to long-off and that's thrown back in
off the back foot and that's driven in front of point
on the money and that's driven back to the bowler
driven without much power in front of point
outside off and that's worked behind point
defended forward
goes for the drive, big inside edge, but runs flat, behind square if you will. I hope you do
on leg and he falls over in front of the sticks
defended forward again
on middle and that's defended forward
outside off, short, and that's eased off the back foot to the covers
tempting, that one looping in from outside off - a bit of fishing from Collingwood, who's normally good against the spinners
defended forward
driven back to the bowler
drags it short and Collingwood puts all his weight behind that one to cut it to the covers - doesn't quite time it, though
tries to pull, doesn't manage to and that's the over
comes forward and that's driven to mid-on
winds up and unwinds a four through midwicket, although he was aiming that through mid-on. Not  a convincing shot, and I'm not always convinced when he faces the spinners
worked round to the 45
without any foot movement, Flintoff drives on the up to the covers
much better shot, rocking back to give himself room to time that through the covers - very nice indeed. I'm always convinced when he faces the spinners
comes forward and puts his bat a long way in front of his knee, defending that one down
on the legs and that's driven out through midwicket, coming back easily for two
pushed up there and that's defended forward
squirts that one in on middle-and-leg and it's worked easily square
cuts back in off the seam and that's "Bowling, bowling, Saqqy"
short, outside off and that's cut in front of point
driven back to the bowler this time

down the track, watches it on to his bat and all the way and that's gone over long-on and it's long gone into the second tier, the cheap seats, where they clap. Prince Harry and co elsewhere are no doubt rattling their jewellery
quicker delivery, cuts back in and that's defended - well bowled, tucking Flintoff right up with that arm ball
on leg and that's swished with poor timing towards fine leg
down leg
down leg ... again
on leg and that's driven out to long-on
right up there, great length, and that's defended down
pushed him on to his back foot and that's defended down
Flintoff back and punches the ball to the man in the deep on the off side
dead-batted to midwicket
Collingwood forward, gentle block
sweet flick off his toes, past midwicket, well timed
cut into the ground and the ball bobbles to point
Collingwood back and pushes the ball to mid-off
leg-side line, worked round the corner and a good sprawling stop by the man on the one

we still have a game here ... Flintoff barely moves his feet and is completely undone by the arm ball and bowled neck and crop. A great player but he looked as impotent as a club No. 11 there. He throws his head back and looks to the heavens ...
off the pads, fine on the leg side,. short fine leg is round quickly to scotch thoughts of a run
into the leg side, again not too sure of the shot
turns past the defensive push, a loud appeal from bowler and keeper, Bucknor smiles - it hit the pad way outside the line of off stump - and eventually says not out
Bopara plays the ball into the ground and via the back of his boot into his stumps ... the fielding side go wild, as well they might, and the half-full ground is a buzz
firm drive to long-on
drifted to leg, steered round the corner with confidence
Collingwood forward, the ball squirts via inside edge past pad and keeper for a single
so close, Nixon plays and misses and the ball shoots in the air past short leg
wide and Nixon gets everything across outside off stump and lets the ball alone
full, tamely driven towards mid-on but the bowler quickly across
hard-handed prod back to the bowler
Collingwood back and turns the ball to leg
turned firmly to midwicket ... Collingwood took a big stride to meet that
arm ball, read by Collingwood who steps back to block
hard drive, a diving stop to his left by the bowler
driven again, this time with slightly more power and Rafique can't move quickly enough to stop that even though it was within three feet of him
outside off stump, left alone
angled down the leg side, Collingwood goes back and steers to deep square leg
Nixon prods, there was a noise and the keeper does a harrier jump jet impression. Bowler and umpire are unconvinced ...
patted back to the bowler
soft-handed drive to mid-on
well-timed caress through the covers
Collingwood back and a quick single as the ball goes to the right of mid-on. These two have decided to push the singles ...
full, Nixon blocks
turned into the hands of short leg, all controlled though
firm push back to the bowler
angled push-drive to backward point
Nixon across to the off to defend
worked fine round on the leg side
Nixon reverse sweeps, the ball goes very fine off his gloves on the off side and they run two
firm drive, a good tumbling stop by the bowler
clipped to midwicket
reverse swept through the covers this time, and that has eased some of the pressure even if it seemed to come off the toe of the bat
this time he opts for the orthodox and blocks
checked drive, the ball balloons over Rafique's head, tantalising, him but it dropped into space
good placement, through midwicket, no dramas, just taking the ones as they come
very correct defensive block
flighted, Collingwood waits and defends
Collingwood chips to mid-on, sends Nixon back for a run that was never there, and mid-on hurls the ball at the stumps with all his might from about eight feet away ... and misses. Nixon safe anyway
defensive push to end the over
Nixon back, gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
fullish and flighted, Collingwood blocks
poor ball, down the leg side, off Colllingwood's hip and a well-run, albeit scurried, two
short and wide, cut to point. That should have been punished
fired in at 65mph, Collingwood back to defend
Collingwood drawn forward, he lunges as misses, the bails are whipped off but his back foot had gone nowhere
Nixon back, waits and punches the ball to mid-on
turned to midwicket, a quick call and the fielder fumbles to ease any pressure there might have been
gentle push to mid-off
outside off, Nixon thrusts a pad out in case, but no spin
far too full, Nixon plays a classic straight drive back over the bowler's head and over the rope as well

Nixon sweeps and seems to miss with the bat, the ball loops up and the keeper runs back three yards and catches the ball. Everyone goes up in expectation, Bucknor consults and the third umpire is woken from his slumber
Collingwood blocks, almost happy to let Nixon do the hitting
outside off stump, Collingwood not remotely tempted
back and pushed into the covers, some aggressive intent but no timing
patted to cover, all very low key
Collingwood back, into line, and dead batted
maiden over, and Collingwood happy with that
Nixon flicks to midwicket
through Nixon, off his front pad and the ball trickles past his leg stump
Nixon a bit hurried there, but safely blocked
angled to backward point
right back, hurriedly turned to midwicket
Nixon again looks for a gap on the leg side and fails to find it
short of a length, Collingwood goes back,  into line and blocks
worked to midwicket
good line from Mortaza, tight and keeping Collingwood pinned down
and again, Collingwood can do no more than push the ball to midwicket
same length, Collingwood back and dead bats the ball to Mortaza
that one beats Collingwood, who had taken two steps to meet it, Mortaza appeals but it was too high  going down the leg side
outside off, Nixon sniffily leaves
an attempted reverse sweep, he misses and leg slip fields the ball as it bounces off the body
again he looks to reverse sweep but it's too wide outside off and Nixon pulls out of the stroke
runs to deep midwicket - at last, the first scoring shot for 23 balls, and some excuse for the sarcastic cheers
driven to long-off ... it's carnage out there now, two in two balls

Nixon tries another reverse sweep, the ball bobbles into the off side and Collingwood, who had called for and come for the run, has to dive full length to regain his ground. A poor throw helped him out
saved by a thick inside edge - it was cleaning him up otherwise - and a run as the ball shoots into the point region
leg side, but the ball really spat as well, and it rocketed under Nixon's armpit and over the keeper's head
full and angled across Nixon, who punches it to mid-off
met with a straight and quite lifeless bat
banged in, Nixon onto it quickly and lofting the ball behind square on the leg side
